edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.symmetricCrypto.encryption

Class ScEncryptThenMac

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.symmetricCrypto.encryption.ScEncryptThenMac
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AuthenticatedEnc, SymmetricEnc, Cca1, Cca2, Cpa, Eav, EncSecLevel, Indistinguishable, NonMalleable, SecurityLevel

    public class ScEncryptThenMac
extends java.lang.Object
implements AuthenticatedEnc
    This class implements a type of authenticated encryption: encrypt then mac.

    The encryption algorithm first encrypts the message and then calculates a mac on the encrypted message.

    The decrypt algorithm receives an encrypted message and a tag. It first verifies the encrypted message with the tag. If verifies, then it proceeds to decrypt using the underlying decrypt algorithm, if not returns a null response.

    This encryption scheme achieves Cca2 and NonMalleable security level.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Yael Ejgenberg)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScEncryptThenMac

        public ScEncryptThenMac()
        Default constructor. Uses default implementations of symmetricEncryption and Mac.

      • ScEncryptThenMac

        public ScEncryptThenMac(SymmetricEnc encryptor,
                Mac mac)
        Constructor that gets a SymmetricEncryption object and a Mac object and sets them as the underlying respective members.
        Parameters:
        encryptor - the SymmetricEncryption that will be used for the encryption part of this scheme.
        mac - the Mac that will be used for the authentication part of this scheme.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given encName is a name of an authenticated encryption.

        public void setKey(javax.crypto.SecretKey secretKey)
            throws java.security.InvalidKeyException

        Specified by:
        setKey in interface SymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
